Token.Abstract: The AFMultipartFormData protocol defines the methods supported by the parameter in the block argument of multipartFormRequestWithMethod:path:parameters:constructingBodyWithBlock:.
Appends HTTP headers, followed by the encoded data and the multipart form boundary.

Parameter.Name: headers
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP headers to be appended to the form data.

Parameter.Name: body
Parameter.Abstract: The data to be encoded and appended to the form data.

Token.Abstract: Appends the HTTP headers Content-Disposition: form-data; name=#{name}", followed by the encoded data and the multipart form boundary.

Parameter.Name: data
Parameter.Abstract: The data to be encoded and appended to the form data.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name to be associated with the specified data. This parameter must not be nil.

Token.Abstract: Appends the HTTP header Content-Disposition: file; filename=#{filename}; name=#{name}" and Content-Type: #{mimeType}, followed by the encoded file data and the multipart form boundary.

Parameter.Name: data
Parameter.Abstract: The data to be encoded and appended to the form data.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name to be associated with the specified data. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: mimeType
Parameter.Abstract: The MIME type of the specified data. (For example, the MIME type for a JPEG image is image/jpeg.) For a list of valid MIME types, see http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: filename
Parameter.Abstract: The filename to be associated with the specified data. This parameter must not be nil.

Token.Abstract: Appends the HTTP header Content-Disposition: file; filename=#{generated filename}; name=#{name}" and Content-Type: #{generated mimeType}, followed by the encoded file data and the multipart form boundary.

Parameter.Name: fileURL
Parameter.Abstract: The URL corresponding to the file whose content will be appended to the form.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name to be associated with the specified data. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: If an error occurs, upon return contains an NSError object that describes the problem.

ReturnValue.Abstract:
YES if the file data was successfully appended, otherwise NO.
@discussion The filename and MIME type for this data in the form will be automatically generated, using NSURLResponse -suggestedFilename and -MIMEType, respectively.

Token.Abstract: Appends encoded data to the form data.

Parameter.Name: data
Parameter.Abstract: The data to be encoded and appended to the form data.

Token.Abstract: Appends a string to the form data.

Parameter.Name: string
Parameter.Abstract: The string to be encoded and appended to the form data.
